text: well just minutes before Air Force one
touchdown president Trump tweeted
attacking the Mayor of London mood
earlier said the UK should not roll out
the red carpet for him the president
said Sadiq Khan who by all accounts has
done a terrible job as mayor of London
has been foolishly nasty to the visiting
President of the United States by far
the most important ally of the United
Kingdom he is a stone-cold loser who
should focus on crime in London not me
Khan reminds me very much of our very
dumb and incompetent mayor of NYC de
Blasio who's also done a terrible job
only half his height in any event I look
forward to being a great friend to the
United Kingdom and I'm looking very much
forward to my visit landing now so that
was just minutes before he touched down
while President Trump and First Lady
Melania were greeted at Stansted Airport
by the Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt
Jeremy Hunt said that one of the first
things the president mentioned was Sadiq
Khan he told me that the president's
visit should be above party politics
this is a president who we've got used
to being very controversial and and very
combative but you know he said he's made
the comments he's made I actually agree
with him that it's totally inappropriate
for the Labour Party to be boycotting
this incredibly important business this
is the president of the United States
we're celebrating the d-day landings and
we had a million American servicemen
stationed in the UK willing to risk
their lives for our liberty for
democracy for our values and I think
that this should be above party politics
so I think it's absolutely disgraceful
not least frankly because today in the
newspapers the Labour Party itself is
being accused of turning a blind eye to
sexism in the labour party headquarters
to to anti-semitism by its candidate in
Peterborough so I think we've got to put
these things aside and remember this is
a very special moment in our
relationship celebrating 75 years of
peace and prosperity because of that
partnership between the UK and the USA
Jeremy Hunt - was amongst those who
greeted the president at Stansted
Airport let's go to our assistant
political editor Norman Smith who is in
Westminster Norman it's a state visit it
should be more about the pomp and
ceremony than the politics but already
the politics have taken center stage
with that Trump that obviously President
Trump knew exactly what he was doing
when he sent it just minutes before
touchdown I mean in some ways Johnny
you'd say well maybe not surprising
given sort of the past track record of
insults between these two men they
obviously heartily loathe each other but
in another way very surprising given
that it is you know an important state
visit given that it is to commemorate
the d-day landings the seriousness of
all that that for some reason the
president you know even before he steps
off the plane is firing off tweets about
Sadiq Khan and then when he gets off the
plane to be greeted by Jeremy Hunt you
know complaining to Jeremy Hunt about
Sadiq Khan and what I conclude from that
is that actually the president you know
won he bears grudges and the two men as
we know have scrapped for the past two
or three years but also slightly
thin-skinned perhaps that he feels the
need to go on the offensive in this way
but it is part and parcel as we know of
the president's makeup he's
unpredictable he does things his way
he's not frightened to speak out for
what it's worth Sadiq Khan
his spokesperson has said that the mayor
regards these as childish insults but
then he's sort of well not going into
the same sort of language as stuck by
the comments he made in the papers
yesterday in effect warning that
President Trump was a sort of return to
the sort of attitudes in the language
that we saw from fascists in the 1930s
and again saying the spokesperson this
morning saying that President Trump was
the most egregious example of this new
right-wing emerging in Europe so the tit
for tat continues even though City Khan
isn't using quite the same sort of
volatile language as the president
